Description Text: Go! Collect $200 as you pass

The Den is an iconic landmark within the Purdue University community that has been serving students and alumni since 1982. Located within easy walking distance from campus, it has something for everyone: university logoed clothing, snacks, soft drinks, cards, novelty gifts, school supplies and more. The most notable item, of course, is the famous “Den Pop” which has become an integral part of the Purdue experience among Boilermakers, both on campus and around the globe.
Rent/Payment Text: Hope you enjoyed your Den Pop! Pay ${} on your way out!
Upgrade Text: Den Pops are cheap, invest $50 to renovate the kitchen and add Mary Lou Donuts. Player will now spend $10 at the Discount Den.

Description Text: Community Chest!

Welcome to University Spirit where you can shop where the coaches and players shop! They have been in operation for over 30 years. Their goals has always been to provide the highest quality and greatest variety of Purdue merchandise available. No matter what you're looking for, 'If it's Gold and Black, we've got it... and more!' They look forward to offering their unique collegiate products to their many loyal Boilermaker fans and friends worldwide. Boiler Up!
Rent/Payment Text: Purdue themed merchandise is not free! Spend ${} to get your Purdue gear and souveniers!
Upgrade Text: Business is slow, invest $50 to create a custom edition shirt. Players will now spend $20 when they come to University Spirit.

Description Text: Time to buy school supplies. This cost you $200. Textbooks and notepads are expensive!

CityBus is a contracted partner with Purdue University for public transportation services. The agreement is called an 'unlimited access' agreement because it gives Purdue students, faculty, and staff unlimited, fare-free access to the CityBus system. The value of the agreement is negotiated each year. Silver Loop operates every 5 minutes Monday-Friday, 7:05 a.m.-6:15 p.m. This route serves the central core of campus and includes destinations such as First Street Towers, Earhart Residence Hall, Cordova Recreational Sports Center, Ford Dining Court, Northwestern Avenue, Purdue Memorial Union and the Memorial Mall.
Rent/Payment Text: Thanks for riding the Silver Loop! Pay ${} for bus fare.

Description Text: Au Bon Pain. Simply put, it means, 'from good bread.' Good bread is the foundation of a good meal. It is the key to a handcrafted sandwich, the essence of a sweet pastry, and the best way to turn a soup or salad into a meal. We pride ourselves on being a gourmet convenience where you live and work that offers good bread as the cornerstone of our marketplace. Convientently located in the Wilmeth Active Learning Center
Rent/Payment Text: Studying is hungry work and you can't resist splurging at Au Bon Pain for those tasty sandwiches and soups! Spend ${} on food from Au Bon Pain.
Upgrade Text: The WALC is a great spot to attract business... but most people aren't interested in waiting for gourmet. Expand the menu by adding ready-made and On-the-go style options for $50. Players will now spend $30 when they visit Au Bon Pain.

Description Text: Chance!

Amelia's is home to fresh sandwiches, soups and salads, which are made in house every day along with other foods and a variety made-to-order beverages. Try the BLT, roast beef, or even PB&J to go with the rotating soup of the day. Located on the lower level of Armstrong Hall of Engineering.
Rent/Payment Text: Sandwiches and Coffee, the flesh and vitae of any engineering student. Spend ${} at Amelia's.
Upgrade Text: Coffee might be universal, but not everyone needs the jitters - especially when they're designing rockets! Spend $50 to add more drinks like Smoothies and Milkshakes to the menu. Players will now spend $30 at Amelia's.

Description Text: Beans lives up to its name with fresh coffee and expresso-based drinks, as well as fresh grab-and-go deli items, baked goods, snacks and a soup of the day. Beans also serves Panda Express rice bowls on location during lunch hours. Located on the first floor of the Materials and Electrical Engineering building.
Rent/Payment Text: You're between classes and need a quick pick-me up to satisfy that caffiene addiction! Spend ${} at Beans.
Upgrade Text: Coffee doesn't keep enough business, invest $50 to add Panda Express during lunch. Players will now spend $40 at Beans.

Description Text: Just visiting....
Two Fellas Grill! Grilled Wraps and Tater Tots. Now serving WMU and Purdue! Late Night Delivery! It\s a Wrap!

Description Text: Coffee is expensive, too bad you need it. Pay $150

Famous Frank's Hot Dog Stand has become a popular pit stop for the late-night bar crowd. From 11:30 p.m. to 3:30 a.m., Frank Farmer and his crew set up The All-American Original Famous Frank's Hot Dog Stand, a large metal trailer where they sell food to passersby. Farmer has owned and operated the hot dog stand for 12 years. Two and half years ago he began setting up his cart across from Harry's Chocolate Shop. Farmer said he got the idea after he saw how well a college friend did with a stand in a similar location.
Rent/Payment Text: Hope the Hot dog was worth it! You owe Frank ${}.
Upgrade Text: The trailer's starting to look rusty and out-dated. What you need is a new paint job! Spend $100 on a hot new paint-job for this culinary set of wheels, and draw in more customers! Players will now spend $50 at Famous Frank's.

Description Text: Mad Mushroom makes all of their food using only the best ingredients and will deliver it right to your door. They make their dough in store daily and all of their vegetables are hand cut so they are always fresh. They offer speedy and reliable delivery service so you never have to wait long to fill your head with the best food in town and getting your hands on some of their famous Original Cheesestix has never been more convenient with their easy to use Online Ordering. Feed Your Head!
Rent/Payment Text: You owe ${}. Enjoy your Cheesy Bread!
Upgrade Text: Most customers order Mad Mush online. Spruce up your website and Online Ordering system for $100 and rake in that dough. Players will now spend $60 at Mad Mushroom.

Description Text: Today, the last iconic Triple XXX Thirst Station remains in West Lafayette, Indiana, where it’s been on the hill, but on the level, since 1929. Just steps from the campus of Purdue University in West Lafayette, Indiana, you can’t help but notice the Triple XXX on the hill in Chauncey Village. Ask almost any regular who sits along the winding countertop how long they’ve been coming in and ordering the Breakfast Special, or Duane Purvis, and you’ll hear some great stories that span generations. Tourists, travelers, and locals alike, could count on great food at affordable prices.
Rent/Payment Text: Hope you enjoyed your burger! Pay {} on the way out.
Upgrade Text: The Drive-In hasn't been used as much in recent years. Spruce it up and launch an ad-campaign for $100 to make drive-in's popular on campus again! Players will now spend $70 at Triple XXX.

Description Text: Community Chest!

The story of O'Bryan's Nine Irish Brothers begins 30 years ago, when founder Jerry O'Bryan told his wife, Jan, that if his other business didn't work out, he wanted to open an Irish pub. Jerry's business, The Hairman, ended up being a campus icon, but after 30 years, two children and a grandchild, Jerry finally decided it was time to realize his dream, an authentic Irish pub serving traditional Irish fare, Guinness by the pint, and featuring live music and the friendly, upbeat atmosphere typical of Irish pubs world-wide. O'Bryan's Nine Irish Brothers is an award-winning traditional Irish pub--recently named the Best Irish Pub in the State of Indiana by Yelp and Buzzfeed, as well as the 'Irish Pub Worth Traveling For' in Indianapolis by TripAdvisor.
Rent/Payment Text: No better time for a pint at Nine Irish! Spend ${} on your Guinness and never forget to settle your tab before the night is out.
Upgrade Text: Live music always draws in the crowds at an Irish pub. Spend $100 on hiring more local talent to play at the pub, and people are going to stay longer for more of that traditional Irish fare. Players will now spend $70 at Nine Irish Brothers.

Description Text: Jimmy John's serve from-scratch food made with excellent ingredients. At Jimmy John'ss the food is simple; it's clean, and it's fresh! They use locally purchased produce, which is brought in fresh and hand sliced daily. Their tuna salad is made from scratch by hand. They real provolone cheese, oven-roasted turkey, choice top round roast beef, real wood-smoked ham, dry cured genoa salami, and spicy capicola are also brought in fresh and sliced by hand daily – in every single Jimmy John's location. Their bread bakers bake our French bread all day, every day. They try to manage bread so that all of our French bread is served within four hours of when it was baked. If you like whole grain wheat bread, try the 9-grain wheat bread – thick sliced and pretty close to perfect.
Rent/Payment Text: Freaky Fast! Freaky Good! Pay ${} for that sandwich.
Upgrade Text: There's a great demand for sandwich delivery these days, and you need fast deliverymen. Spend $100 on better bikes and more deliverymen to deliver Jimmy John's. Players will now spend $80 when they order from Jimmy John's.

Description Text: Free Parking! As long as it's not Mon-Fri, 7am-5pm

Brothers is a modernized throwback to the old Midwestern corner tavern. A clean, relaxed social hangout; our bar stock-full of cold beer and drink with a kitchen in the back serving up comfortable American food fare. Food portions are large and juicy; Drink prices are good and plenty.  A lot of televisions and not a bad seat in the house. It's hard to imagine you won't leave here satisfied.
Rent/Payment Text: Hope you enjoyed your night! Pay your tab of {} before you leave!
Upgrade Text: Thursday nights start slow, invest $90 in buying T-shirts and giving them out for free. Players will now spend $150 at Brothers.

Description Text: Chance!

Every week the Neon Cactus brings you the most variety of entertainment under one roof! With over 22,000 square feet the Neon Cactus provides something for almost anyone to enjoy!... Combine the largest dance floor with fantastic in-house DJs and you have no reason not to dance all night long! Pool tables, darts and over a dozen televisions, including 4 large projection screens make every seat in the main room a GREAT ONE to catch up on the days events and watch sports while they happen! SOCIAL! with Bruce 'The Piano Man' Barker in the Rusty Bucket and enjoy AND participate in the area's longest running live act!
Rent/Payment Text: Hope you enjoyed your night! Pay your tab of {} before you leave!

Description Text: In 1919, Harry J. Marack opened Harry'ss Chocolate Shop at 329 West State Street in West Lafayette, Indiana. The Marack family operated the Chocolate Shop as the only Soda Fountain near Purdue University well into the 1920s. Primarily serving fountain drinks and luncheonette items, they acquired a license to serve beer and subsequently liquor. Opened as a family business in 1919, it has operated as so for more than 80 years at the same corner of State and Pierce Streets.
Rent/Payment Text: Hope you enjoyed your night at the Chocalate Shop! Pay your tab of {} before you leave!
Upgrade Text: Credit card fees are high, invest $150 to implement a $10 minimum on all credit purchases. Players will now spend $100 at Harry's Chocolate Shop.

Description Text: Providing the Purdue community with recreational and wellness activities that contribute to learning and the pursuit of an active, healthy lifestyle, Purdue's Cordova Recreational Sports Center will be a recognized leader in developing individuals to pursue lifelong wellness. It will create a respectful environment that celebrates the intrinsic worth of each individual, facilitates an open exchange of ideas, nurtures creative expression, and accentuates cross cultural interaction. Recreation plays a powerful role in transformative learning and enhances academic performance.
Rent/Payment Text: Membership at the Co-Rec might be free for students, but not the amazing group classes nor the smoothies! Spend ${} at the Co-Rec.
Upgrade Text: Working out at the gym, swimming at the pool, or climbing a rock-wall... doesn't matter what you are doing at the Co-Rec, you're sure to be thirsty at the end of it! Capitalize on their thirst and spend $150 on adding a Freshen's so that people at the Co-Rec can satisfy their thirst with deliciously cool smoothies! Players will now spend $110 at the Purdue Co-Rec.

Description Text: Nestled on the northern edge of the Purdue University campus, venerable Ross-Ade Stadium celebrates its 94th season as the home of Boilermaker football in 2017. Ross-Ade was dedicated Nov. 22, 1924, in a game against intrastate rival Indiana, which the Boilermakers won 26-7. The stadium is named for its two principal benefactors, alumni David E. Ross, former president of the Board of Trustees, and George Ade, a playwright and humorist. It was Ross who conceived the idea for the stadium and selected the site. He and Ade purchased and presented to the university the 65-acre tract on which the stadium is located. In 2006, a cold-tolerant strain of Bermuda grass was installed in Ross-Ade, making it the first Big Ten Conference stadium with such a surface. A year later, a 31-foot by 68-foot Daktronics video board was installed at the south end of Ross-Ade to significantly improve replay and other entertainment possibilities. The South End Zone Patio, which features tailgate food and beverages in an attractive 16,000-square foot area, opened in 2014 and is available to football season-ticket holders and Purdue students who are members of the Ross-Ade Brigade. The patio is a temporary addition while plans for a multi-purpose building are considered.
Rent/Payment Text: The team might not be the greatest in the nation, but buying tickets and watching a home game is great for School Spirit! Spend ${} on football tickets!
Upgrade Text: Football is not doing great, invest $150 and make students buy Football Tickets with their Basketball Tickets. Players will now spend $110 at Ross-Aide Stadium.

Description Text: Time to buy graceries! This cost you $150

Purdue teams have won nearly 80 percent of the games played in Mackey, and through the 2016-17 season, the men's program boasted a 606-138 record (.815 winning percentage) and the women's program a 431-143 record (.751 winning percentag).Originally named Purdue Arena, groundbreaking for the circular concrete and steel structure with a domed roof took place July 20, 1965. It was hailed as 'the first of its kind among collegiate sports facilities.' The $6 million project took just over two years to complete and was dedicated Dec. 2, 1967, with a ceremony that included recognizing 10 former Boilermaker All-Americans, led by John Wooden and Charles 'Stretch' Murphy, and a speech by Indiana governor Roger Branigin.
Rent/Payment Text: Basketball at Purdue is always a fun show, and Mackey Arena is an amazing place to watch our atheletes. Spend ${} on basketball tickets. Go Boilermakers!
Upgrade Text: Basketball is not doing great, invest $150 in a new coach. Players will now spend $120 at Mackey Arena.

The vibrant and historic downtown Lafayette includes quaint coffee shops, restaurants, bars, shopping and the state’s oldest drive-through restaurant. Fuse offers studio, one-, two-, three-, and four-bedroom floor plans. Each apartment home comes fully furnished in modern design including stainless steel appliances, quartz counter tops, hardwood-style floors, and more. Additionally, Fuse offers community amenities unbeatable anywhere else in Lafayette including a fully equipped gym, yoga studio, free bike rental, retail on the first floor and more!

Description Text: Chance!

You need a campus store partner that shares your mission, understands your reality, and demonstrates a successful past and visionary future. As the largest college store operator in North America, Follet's serves 5 million students across nearly 1,200 stores - fueling education everywhere learning takes place. This broad perspective enables Follett's to move beyond the traditional campus bookstore to serve as a gateway to knowledge and enhance the campus experience for students.
